meanings.definition: Lasting or existing forever; without end
meanings.sent1: The love between a parent and child is eternal.
meanings.sent2: The stars in the sky seem eternal, shining brightly every night.
meanings.sent3: The eternal wait for the school bell to ring felt like an eternity.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an eternal flame, warming everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The ancient tree stood tall, its branches reaching for the eternal sky.

meanings.sent1: The eternal hum of the air conditioner filled the room.
meanings.sent2: The eternal flow of the river never ceased, always moving forward.
meanings.sent3: The eternal ticking of the clock became a soothing lullaby.
meanings.sent4: His eternal optimism was a ray of sunshine on gloomy days.
meanings.sent5: The eternal dance of the flames mesmerized the onlookers.

meanings.sent1: The eternal line at the amusement park made them reconsider their visit.
meanings.sent2: The eternal expanse of the desert stretched out before them.
meanings.sent3: The eternal loop of the catchy song played in his mind all day.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed in the room, creating an eternal joy.
meanings.sent5: The eternal depths of the ocean held mysteries waiting to be discovered.
